questions.question_text:
A project manager who is part of a global team wants to have a team building meeting and decides to hold a video conference.
Which of the following is MOST likely to be the main challenge the influences this decision?

discussion.content: I think Time Difference would be a Factor affecting team members from different geographies, so A sounds more Correct..
The answer is A. The question is not asking what challenges will be faced since the decision is made, it is asking what WERE the challenges that influenced this decision in the first place.

Because it says "MOST likely to be the main challenge the influences this decision?" There is a typo but it should say main challenge that influences this decision ...geography influenced the decision.

comments.content:
Answer is A!
When team members are scattered across time zones or global
hemispheres, the time zone difference can affect the timely delivery of
messages. It's important to consider the message's destination when
choosing how and when you will communicate. Voice and video
conferencing can help to bridge the geographical gap, but be careful to
avoid meeting when someone should be sleeping.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Why would geography matter when it's a video conference?
What is the logic here? Who told the PM!? B makes sense depending on WHO told the PM!!? Was it a team member was it the team member who is sick!? CompTIA is terrible at being direct!

A. Project sponsor (which I believe is the correct one)

B. Human resources office (the Pm was notified, so they already know he will be out for a long time ) "a projectized organization is notified that a team member is ill and will be out for an extended period of time."

C. Budget office (makes no sense, but only if they approved the budget in which his absence and paid leave will become a problem for the project $$$, as they will need to find a new resource for this which will make the whole thing more expensive) maybe overthinking too much.

D. Project team For me makes no sense due to this "This team member is the only person with a key skill set." No team member will be able to replace it.

So the PM should get to the sponsor to notify this, as he needs to find a replacement to check what can be done.

F this exam I am overthinking things?
